segment.source: Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts
segment.target: Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts

segment.source: Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts
segment.target: Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts

segment.source: Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts
segment.target: Winpeshl.ini Reference: Launching an app when WinPE starts

segment.source: Use the Winpeshl.ini file in Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to replace the default command prompt with a shell application or other app.
segment.target: Use the Winpeshl.ini file in Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) to replace the default command prompt with a shell application or other app.

segment.source: For example, your shell app might provide a GUI for deployment engineers to choose a method of installing Windows.
segment.target: For example, your shell app might provide a GUI for deployment engineers to choose a method of installing Windows.

segment.source: To add a customized app, create a file named Winpeshl.ini and place it in %SYSTEMROOT%System32 a customized Windows PE image.
segment.target: To add a customized app, create a file named Winpeshl.ini and place it in %SYSTEMROOT%System32 a customized Windows PE image.

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: The Wpeshl.ini file may have either or both of the sections: LaunchApp and LaunchApps.
segment.target: The Wpeshl.ini file may have either or both of the sections: LaunchApp and LaunchApps.

segment.source: The apps listed in LaunchApp and LaunchApps run in order of appearance, and don’t start until the previous app has terminated.
segment.target: The apps listed in LaunchApp and LaunchApps run in order of appearance, and don’t start until the previous app has terminated.

segment.source: LaunchApp
segment.target: LaunchApp

segment.source: Set the entry to the path to your app.
segment.target: Set the entry to the path to your app.

segment.source: You can use a fully qualified path, or you can include environment variables, such as to describe the path.
segment.target: You can use a fully qualified path, or you can include environment variables, such as to describe the path.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The LaunchApp entry may only include one app.
segment.target: The LaunchApp entry may only include one app.

segment.source: You can’t specify a command that is greater than 250 characters.
segment.target: You can’t specify a command that is greater than 250 characters.

segment.source: You can’t specifiy any command-line options with LaunchApp.
segment.target: You can’t specifiy any command-line options with LaunchApp.

segment.source: LaunchApps
segment.target: LaunchApps

segment.source: Use the section to run apps with command-line options.
segment.target: Use the section to run apps with command-line options.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: LaunchApps supports running apps, but does not support common scripting commands.
segment.target: LaunchApps supports running apps, but does not support common scripting commands.

segment.source: To run commands, add a startup script instead (startnet.cmd).
segment.target: To run commands, add a startup script instead (startnet.cmd).

segment.source: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize.
segment.target: For more information, see WinPE: Mount and Customize.

segment.source: You can’t specify a command that is greater than 250 characters.
segment.target: You can’t specify a command that is greater than 250 characters.

segment.source: To add command-line options to an app: add a comma (,) after the app name:
segment.target: To add command-line options to an app: add a comma (,) after the app name:

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: WinPE for Windows 10
